reviews.review_msg: What can I say. Rarely do you get a prof. that is so involved in the learning for students. Lynne wants nothing but success from those she teaches, and went above and beyond on multiple occasions to ensure students understood the course content and by making herself available outside of class.
Awesome prof! Cares deeply about the subject matter, and helping students understand material in the course! Amazing professor :)
I LOVE KINDER MORGAN.
Go to class, the quizzes are freebies!! She's such a passionate prof and she loves what she teaches.  The exams are fair but you have to read the papers and know the experimental techniques.
Best prof i've had for MBB. Simply amazing. Has ability to convey complicated/challenging material unlike most profs. Go to lecture

One of the easiest professors I've encountered. Her lectures help clear any questions you may have but heavily based on textbook. Read the text and study by it, and you'll ace the exams. As simple as that.

Lynne is a fabulous prof who has a deep interest in her subject of teaching. ASK QUESTIONS when you are confused and you'll get them answered efficiently and without attitude. She is nice to students and cares how we do. The textbook was essential - EVERY ANSWER was in the textbook. So read ahead and ask questions and you'll do JUUUUST fine.

Great prof. Extremely nice and very clear. Sure her notes are mostly diagrams but that's why you're supposed to read the textbook. Material was interesting. Way better course than MBB 222. Only qualm with Quarmby is that my final mark was 85.5/100 and I ended up with only a B+. How does that happen?
The BEST Prof I have had!!! Very helpful and very nice with her students

Lynne is definately one of the nicest profs. Her course material is boring and she tries to make it as interesting as possible. Her exams are fair, my only criticism is that her notes are full of diagrams and they sometimes lack the explanation of the diagrams.
my favorite

For those students who complain about Lynne, allow me to welcome you to FOURTH YEAR UNIVERSITY! In the real world, you don't get powerpoint presentations sent to you 2 weeks beforehand! Lecturers frequently go fast; there's a lot of info to share. Lynne has a genuine concern for her students, and a love for the subject matter. Appreciate THAT!
If you are an average to poor student you will not be ale to keep up and you will hate her, If you are up to the challenge and are interested in cell biology you will love this course.

One of the most influential profs I have ever had. She truly cares about students and has a passion for what she teaches. She is challenging, but you will come out of her courses with a respect for the bigger picture in biology.
She deducted EXTRA marks if we answered a question wrong on the final.  That's right, you can get a NEGATIVE mark on the final!!!  If you value your GPA, avoid this course!!!
She goes way too fast during lectures...esp. since she uses powerpoint and doesn't make her notes available to her students.  There was no textbook for the course either.

403 is an advanced class so material that is review goes very quickly, new info is slowly and clearly explained. She is VERY helpful in office hours. Don't take this course if you are slow. If you are intrested though you will LOVE it.

she doesn't provide online notes but she's more than willing to explain absolutely anything to you no matter how straight forward you think it should be. out of all the prof's i've ever had, she has the best attitudes towards students

Warning:  If you love the movie "Speed", you will love her teaching style.  Absolutely no pause in between, armed with power point with button happy fingers. If you don't like unclarity and amazing speed, don't even think about taking the challe
This just goes to show why it should be manditory for professors to take at least six credits of education courses. I believe she has a lot to improve on if she truly wants to teach undergrads.
Super unclear, exam super hard and super unfairly marked.  That's right, not exaggeration.

There are some suggestions we have for this prof.: Speak slower, speak clearly, post the notes on the web (or at least don't use power-point if going to flip through it like shuffling a deck of cards), have a course textbook which we can buy.
She knows and loves her stuff!

i've taken this course twice (no, i'm not an idiot, i just didn't prepare well for such a demanding course), and so far Quarmby's been doing a pretty good job. she actually has a passion for the material (which can help b/c cell biology can be a bit dry).
although she is trying to make this course interesting, her teaching style just isn't very helpful for students at all>< also, her exam is always long and tough><...try to avoid her if you can...

She's a very approachable prof.  The way she taught the course, however, was not my cup of tea.  Her lecture slides were totally pointless.  If I want to see figures from the textbook, I can always look them up in the textbook myself.
She's a nice person, but it's hard to listen in class when i'm frantically trying to take down notes. But then again this doesn't happen all of the time.
she's got no love for the slackers... "where is the love?"

Shes a very nice prof, its just her pacing. I like how she goes in depth about important concept she likes but I hate how she glosses over other impt concepts when she runs out of time. I think she just needs to leave the extra details for another course.

The best proffessor I have ever had. Also a really nice person - for those of you who are havong trouble, try going to talk to her. Although her class may be fast at times, if you take notes well and understand the major concepts, you will be fine!!

Clearly has high interest in the material but goes far too quickly in lecture. Many times when trying to clarify, she'll confuse you even more with extraneous info. She doesn't believe in putting notes on-line, which would make lectures more productive.

Teaches very fast, but makes things interesting.  Exams are long, BUT that is a GOOD thing (pick out the questions you KNOW how to do and skip the ones you don't..) and they will scale it afterwards (i.e. 2003-2 semester MT1 out of 60, made it out of 45.5
can't teach
No Comments
weird exams
in her defence, first time teaching the class
No Comments
